text: Erigeron acomanus is a rare North American species of flowering plant in the aster family known by the common names bluewater fleabane and Acoma fleabane. It has been found only in sandstone soils in west-central New Mexico.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution map ==Description== Erigeron acomanus is a small perennial her rarely more than 15 centimeters (6 inches) tall, spreading by means of underground rhizomes. Each plant generally produces only one flower head, with 16–30 white ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Erigeron acomanus Spellenberg & P. J. Knight, Acoma fleabane Spellenberg, Richard William & Knight, Paul J. 1989. Madroño 36(2): 115–120 The species is named for the Native American community called Acoma Pueblo in New Mexico. ==References== acomanus Category:Flora of New Mexico Category:Plants described in 1989
